ol.li:
Contains exactly one [1..1] expirationDate with data type Point In Time
"Contains the expiration date of the medical substance administered. Note: vaccine expiration dates do not always have a "day" component; therefore, such a date may be transmitted as YYYYMM." - HL7 Version 2.8, RXA-16 "Contains the expiration date of the medical substance administered." - HL7 Version 2.8, RXD-19. "The date and time the manufacturer no longer ensures the safety, quality, and/or proper functioning of the material." - HL7 Version 3

Contains exactly one [1..1] lotId with data type String
"Contains the lot number of the medical substance administered. Note: The lot number is the number printed on the label attached to the container holding the substance and on the packaging which houses the container. If the substance is a vaccine, for example, and a diluent is required, a lot number may appear on the vial containing the diluent; however, any such identifier associated with a diluent is not the identifier of interest. The substance lot number should be reported, not that of the diluent." - HL7 Version 2.8, RXA-15 "Contains the lot number of the medical substance administered." - HL7 Version 2.8, RXD-18. "An alphanumeric string used to identify a particular batch of manufactured material." - HL7 Version 3
Contains exactly one [1..1] lotSize with data type Physical Quantity

Contains exactly one [1..1] expirationDate with data type Point In Time
"Contains the expiration date of the medical substance administered. Note: vaccine expiration dates do not always have a "day" component; therefore, such a date may be transmitted as YYYYMM." - HL7 Version 2.8, RXA-16 "Contains the expiration date of the medical substance administered." - HL7 Version 2.8, RXD-19. "The date and time the manufacturer no longer ensures the safety, quality, and/or proper functioning of the material." - HL7 Version 3

"Contains the lot number of the medical substance administered. Note: The lot number is the number printed on the label attached to the container holding the substance and on the packaging which houses the container. If the substance is a vaccine, for example, and a diluent is required, a lot number may appear on the vial containing the diluent; however, any such identifier associated with a diluent is not the identifier of interest. The substance lot number should be reported, not that of the diluent." - HL7 Version 2.8, RXA-15 "Contains the lot number of the medical substance administered." - HL7 Version 2.8, RXD-18. "An alphanumeric string used to identify a particular batch of manufactured material." - HL7 Version 3
Contains exactly one [1..1] lotSize with data type Physical Quantity
